intro: Tithymalus duvalii, commonly known as the Duval's tithymale, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tithymalus duvalii is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
